alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Floyd; Jackson; Johnson; Knott; Knox; Laurel; Lee; Leslie; Magoffin; Martin; Morgan; Owsley; Perry; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 10:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Knox, Owsley, eastern Jackson, Knott, northwestern Floyd, southern Lee, central Wolfe, northeastern Laurel, southwestern Martin, central Morgan, southern Johnson, Leslie, Perry, Breathitt, Magoffin and Clay Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1052 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Licksburg to Rousseau to near Flintville to Wolf Coal to Urban. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Salyersville, Stringtown, Rousseau, Perlie, Licksburg, Guage, Cyrus, Hardshell, Stevenson and Sikes around 1055 PM EDT. Mason, Lunah, Mashfork, Noble, Camp Lewis, Burning Fork, Ned, Falcon, Lamont and Brownlow around 1100 PM EDT. Dice, Conley, Daisydell, Lambric, Ivyton, Bradley, Ballot, Rowdy, Oil Springs and West Royalton Station around 1105 PM EDT. Hazard, Buck, Riceville, Goose Rock, Decoy, Marshallville, Gypsy, Hector, Tiptop and Duco around 1110 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Botto, Plank, Swamp Branch, Dobson, Evanston, Bulan, Leander, Ary, Patrick, Brainard, Vail, Bonanza, Fisty, Lipps, Emmalena, Cordia, Elmrock, Brightshade, Bearville, Ice Cliff, Hindman, Ritchie, Vest, Yellow Mountain, Ashers Fork, Elic, Carrie, Tina, Creekville, Bays Branch, Prestonsburg, Estill, Martin, Pippa Passes, Vicco, Allen, Soft Shell, Handshoe, Cliff and Roark. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 47 and 76. Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 12 and 59. Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 4. Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 14. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 20. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 9 and 21. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 0 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Clay; Floyd; Jackson; Johnson; Knott; Knox; Laurel; Lee; Leslie; Magoffin; Martin; Morgan; Owsley; Perry; Wolfe
